results.title: In search of golden footprints
results.creator_credit: Andrew Swift and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Andrew Swift was raised in a small mining town in the foothills of the Victorian Alpine country. The more he learnt about the history of mining in the region, the more his interest in the remote areas of the Alps increased. Andrew’s exploration of the area has unearthed evidence of the long forgotton gold mines and the stories of the people who worked there.

results.creator_credit: Alex Pomasanoff, Alan Landsburg Productions and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Examines several major earthquakes and summarises the current technology of earthquake prediction. Traces the 500 mile San Andreas fault and shows its definite movements.

results.title: In search of balance
results.creator_credit: National Recreation and Park Association and Anthony T Lorch
results.brief_description: A film to make communities aware of the value and need for recreation and park services. Illustrates passive and active recreation, solitary and group interaction and structured and unstructured activities. Also reveals the many concerns of environmentalists and conservationists and traces the origin of recreation as we know it today.

results.title: In search of Anna
results.creator_credit: Storm Productions, Australian Film Commission, Victorian Film Corporation and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: Tony has just been released from Pentridge after serving six years for robbery. He sets out to settle old scores and search for his girlfriend Anna. In the process he hitches a ride north with the enigmatic Sam and a relationship develops between them. The theme of coming to terms with the past is expressed formally through the non-chronological structure which produces a split narrative - the Melbourne scenes and the journey north - which inform each other as the story unfolds. Underlying the journey to awareness is the city/country antinomy - the country has the power to liberate what the city has entrapped. Features the music of AC/DC, Rose Tattoo, Stiletto, The Angels and Steve Wright. Cast includes Richard Moir, Judy Morris, Chris Haywood, Bill Hunter, Ian Nimmo, Maurie Fields.

results.title: In search of adventure
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Kirsty McGeoch and ACMI
results.brief_description: After five years of study, Kirsty McGeoch had a law degree and a lifetime of career achievements ahead. Something, however, was telling her not to do it and to follow another path. Ultimately, this story is about honouring what fulfils the spirit.

results.title: In search of a landscape
results.creator_credit: Hannah Dunne and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: The pre-performance preparations by Hannah Dunne and her dance troupe as they practice for their performance of “In search of a landscape”. results.title: In recognition
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Gerald Ashcroft and ACMI
results.brief_description: ‘Capturing the light and being in the moment, what more could you ask for?’ Gerald Ashcroft’s mother talked him out of giving up piano with a garden hoe. Many years on, he is grateful for that, as he is for his two beautiful daughters.

results.title: In pursuit of the possible
results.creator_credit: Alistair Innes, Ian Host and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hypothetical (Television Program)”.
Moderated by Geoffrey Robertson, this program examines, by means of hypothetical situations, the role that Australia can play in meeting the challenges posed by disarmament and arms control. The program has been divided into three parts to facilitate its use by community and educational groups and to permit discussion of the various issues as they arise.
